revised_title: Investigations on Gaseous Spectra and the Physical Constitution of the Sun
tldr: Frankland and Lockyer investigate the spectra of various gases and the physical constitution of the sun, focusing on the hydrogen spectrum and the chromosphere. They find that the widening of spectral lines is due to pressure, and suggest that the sun's photosphere is gaseous rather than solid or liquid, contrary to the prevailing theory at the time.
